title.label: Latest update crashes app mid game

content.label: I upgraded but did not purchase the new leaders expansion. Now when I play a challenge the app crashes approximately half way through the game. This needs to be tested and fixed ASAP.

Love the game! 

It would be better if they introduce ELO or some rating system.

Bought this on a family vacation as a long-flight time-passer. Hadn’t played the tabletop edition, but my wife’s a fan of it, and this adaption proved faithful enough that she was able to teach me to play. Have had an enormous amount of fun since.

Small critique: I miss the ability to mix human and AI opponents in pass-and-play. And I gotta say, I feel disappointed that Sid Meier shows up as a leader. I get the homage/joke, but it feels like he’s occupying a slot that could have gone to anyone other than another white dude. (Nelson Mandela?)

title.label: For people who want a challenging board game

content.label: My collection of video games and board games is immense but this is the most solid app I own. If you want a rewarding board game experience then you want this game. If you find history interesting or if you love building efficient engines than you want this. But if you have a short attention span or get easily discouraged, than this might not be the game for you.

I own a lot of board games both on iPad and in reality. This is a pretty cool game and a very nice implementation. At the hardest level of AI the game provided a real challenge. No glitches with 10 games played. If you like iPad board games played solo, this is a solid choice. This is a very high ranking game on boardgamegeek. I don’t think it would go over well with my tabletop gaming group because of its “take that” mechanic, so I really value getting to play it here.

Almost better than the actual game which is slow and arduous. Love the art, quality, challenges and features! 

Might even recommend it over the actual board game if you have a tablet that you can pass to or online play with friends.

Not random at all.  Game will always have cards needed to counter you, you never get cards that might put you ahead.  Frustrating in the extreme, not fun at all.  Fanboys will probably say, ‘you have to learn the game/strategy’, but I did so.  It’s like a lot of games that are out there that are supposed to be rng type games but are not.   Don’t throw your money away....you’ve been warned.
So much depth and replayability I highly recommend
This game is amazing. Hours of entertainment. It does take a few tries to understand the game, def play the tutorial a couple of times once you start. But you will love this game!
All the calculations are bypassed.  The game is otherwise a true representation of the board version of the game.

I’ve enjoyed this game tremendously while sidelined after surgery. After many, many games the “novice” opponents are still challenging. I’m giving it 4/5 stars because it really has trouble on my iPad Air 1. I needed to turn off sounds and animations for AI players and it’s best to avoid four-player games. In the final few rounds the game stutters badly until eventually it will crash. Repeatedly. Sticking to three total players (two AI) is easy to do, but some of the challenge matches require four.
Game doesn’t connect 90 percent of the time...DO NOT BUY

For those of you who are wondering, this is exactly like the board game.

For those of you who have never heard of this game, it is a challenging game which can get easier with a well thought out plan. Though the game will go through the same deck of cards, depending on the order and with some luck, the game will turn out somewhat differently than the last.
The game seems very well designed and thoughtout!!! A+ all the way.
I have only played for a day and I already love it!
Never played the board game, but this is a great game with an excellent iOS implementation.

This is a great game for those who enjoy strategy and/or board games.  I’ve owned the game since it first came out, and still enjoy playing.  I never played the board game, and learned from playing the computer and other human opponents in multiplayer games.  The developer has been very responsive while some of the bugs were being worked out, but I haven’t encountered a bug or performance issue in a while.  Typically, I don’t review games, but I make exceptions when the game and developer support are top notch.

title.label: IMHO best digital board game port ever

content.label:
As both an avid tabletop gamer and someone who owns ever digital port out there (also own the physical games too), I can say without a doubt this is the best iPad board game/port I have ever played. Extremely true to the real game, amazing graphic design, intuitive UI and mechanics feel tight and fluid. This is a must have for all board game enthusiasts. 

Two small issues that I think bring it down a little- (a) cannot add AI players to local pass and play, (b) there should be an option to hide military cards when playing with pass and play. This can be a real issue as in the real game watching your opponents turn is extraordinarily important to playing well. I really wish you could turn the cards over with a click (like having a hand of cards). If these issues were fixed a strong 5 stars!!

title.label: Great Wall of China, this is it

content.label: Why do you have an IPhone? To play this great game!  No glitches, all the SNAFU and FUBAR is up to me! And I do a lot of both, but I keep LEARNING; this game is about Expanding you MIND!

title.label: Entertaining Civ-Style Game, Needs Balanced Warfare

content.label:
For those of us who enjoy Civ-style strategy games, Through The Ages is a solid multiplayer card game that provides a fun overview of the usual Civ experience.  Choose your leaders and follow your path to greatness over the course of the ages. Great as a solo game versus AI, or timed multiplayer versus other players worldwide.

BUT:

The biggest issue with this game is that warfare is woefully imbalanced.  The most common path to victory appears to be winning the early race to largest army - combine that with a healthy number of aggression or warfare events, and you are practically guaranteed victory.

The problem as I see it is that aggression is an all or nothing event. If the aggressor wins, there is no cost to that player whatsoever, no matter how close the victim comes to a successful defense.  In warfare, the spoils go to the person with the stronger military - attacker OR defender.  I would like to see these same rules applied in the aggression events.
Two games in and both ended in bugs preventing advancement.

title.label: The best board game on iOS

content.label: Great game and great implementation! Love the asynchronous multiplayer.

I have had server access issues for weeks now. Support has admitted that he has a problem but they have not fixed yet and indeed things seem to be getting worse. Overall a good solid game that I have enjoyed but I am about to delete it for this time for good.

title.label: Don’t purchase until connectivity issues are fixed

content.label:
When working properly, this game is really well done. Great interface, intuitive, true to the board game but with worthwhile digital improvements. It should get 5 stars. 

Connectivity issues, however, make this a frustrating purchase. At least once a day over the past several months I’ve found it impossible to play because the server can’t handle the traffic. This is especially frustrating when playing a live game where your failure to play results in your forfeit. If I were buying this for the first time I’d wait until someone I trust told me the connectivity issues were resolved. Until then you’ll just be paying for something that works only part of the time.

By far, the best board game adaption in the App Store and one of the best games, period.  Minor crashing issues that are mostly irrelevant due to frequent auto saves.  AI is fantastic to play against as well.

It doesn’t let you play the cool cards early enough. It seems you finally get set up and game over. The way to win is not as fun as the game play itself. Therefore by the time it is getting good it ends.
갓겜갓글

title.label: Good implementation ruined by connectivity issues

content.label: I enjoyed this game for months but the latest update is highly unstable - connection takes several minutes and you still get thrown off if and when you finally reach the server.  I don’t know what the update ‘fixed’ but it has rendered the game nearly unplayable.

Awesome board game, and this implementation of it is brilliant and beautiful.  I love it, and play it everyday online and have already hooked three other friends on it.

My only complaint would be that they need to stabilize their network more.  Disconnects are far too common, but I know they are aware of the issue and are working on it.

If you like strategy games or board games this one is superb.  My first exposure to this board game was this digital version. The tutorial is great, the interface is awesome and winning is very rewarding. It took me a few games to get comfortable with everything but the experience is worth the effort. I just want to thank the developers on such a wonderful product. Worth every single dollar.
Great tutorial. Smart design. Very well done!
I’ll be playing this game for the rest of my life.

Wow!  Just wow!  Excellent adaptation of the board game.  Smooth and easy to use.  Also very forgiving - redo button - is great especially for new players.  While I miss the table talk, I don’t miss the upkeep mess.  Great job!
If you enjoy strategic IOS games then you owe it to yourself to get this app. It is fantastic and well worth the price.

Brilliant port of one of the greatest board games of all time. The developers have been devoted to ensuring that this title remains one of the absolute best on iOS. They have worked tirelessly to address community and provider issues while navigating the troubled waters of iOS development, including Apple’s ever-changing software and hardware requirements. This is and should always be expected, but CGE has proven far better than the vast majority of dev teams who engage in such undertakings. They have continued to support one of the finest digital board game implementations out there regardless of platform. Thanks CGE and keep up the phenomenal work.
Cannot play this game on iPhone. It’s not configured for this screen. Fix it and I’ll change the rating.
A lot of fun, especially on the larger iPad screen.

I so desperately want to play this game, but the screen size and dimensions of the iPhone X make it impossible. First, text on the right and bottom of the screen is obscured. But more egregiously, you cannot build wonders because their location is obscured by the card row. 

Please please fix this screen layout issue soon!!!!!
It’s a challenge and takes a bit to learn but it is totally worth it

title.label: Love this game, but lately, it crashes non-stop!

content.label:
At first, I thought I had wasted money on this game but the reality was I simply didn’t get it. After giving it some time, I fell in love with it and have an amazing time with the challenges and learning new strategies. 

Unfortunately, in the last few weeks (maybe since last update and I didn’t play enough to notice), the game has been crashing excessively. I’m talking like 5 times in 20 min. It will freeze mid-turn, and I’ll need to shut it down and reopen game. 

I am on a fairly new iPhone 7+, with updated iOS, and I’ve already restarted phone multiple times since noticing the issue so I feel it’s definitely on the game’s end. 

If this issue is corrected, the game is 5 stars. It’s 100% worth the price point, it’s challenging on many levels and has tons of replay value. I just can’t get through a single game without a freeze or crash anymore, thus the 3 Star review.

title.label: Great game unless you have T-Mobile

content.label:
This is an excellent game that really sets the bar for board game ports. Clean and clear UI, good AI, excellent multiplayer. So why only one star?

This game will NOT work on T-Mobile’s network. From what I’ve read, it doesn’t properly support IPv6, and T-Mobile no longer supports IPv4 on iOS. As a result, I can only play multiplayer on Wi-Fi, and have lost many games due to timeout as a result. It’s a real shame that such a great game fails on a core feature: Internet connectivity. CGE has known about this bug since last year and has been promising a fix, but nothing so far.

I loved the board game and I think the app is a great adaptation.  Works on both iPhone and my IPad.  No complaints at all, if you are used to friendly games where no one uses military you might be in for a surprise, but after a few games you figure out you better keep up especially in the last age. Basically if the other players are not trying to add culture even by age 2 its clear they are waiting for Napoleon.  It’s hard once you fall behind on military or government to recover.  So if I had a complaint it would be that.  However you can find a few friends that all agree not to be obnoxious.  Just like anywhere else on the internet.

If you don’t know the game there is a steep learning curve.  That isn’t new to the app, the game always takes a little to get used to.  I found that the first few games I would lose track of certain things that happened previously.  But after a while got used to not seeing the score or so the other players screens on a table in front of me.  It’s all there you have know where to look. I say get the game and enjoy.

title.label: Terrible app with developer team that doesn’t respond in a timely manner

content.label:
I played 5 games this weekend. In 2 of them I came across 2 bugs. “Inconsistency report” in one that forces a random person to resign since their code can’t handle a simple turn based game. Another game randomly gave me 2 extra ore per turn because the app can’t handle more than one pact per person.

I urge everyone not to buy this game. While sometimes the game is fun, it can be infuriating to deal with all these bugs. The inconsistency bug I reported weeks ago and they still have done nothing to fix it.

They also don’t respond to emails over the weekend when most people play the game and most bugs occur. So your time will run out before they could even attempt to fix it since they refuse to look at email on Saturday or Sunday.

Combine luck, and careful consideration- mix with aggravation from opponent play, stir in deep strategy, top with replayability-  Difficult to master, fun to play
A recipe that works well if your going to design a classic- and this game is

title.label: Needs online play on a cellular network

content.label: The game is good.  The only problem I have is that I can only play the online games with a wifi connection.  I have a fast and reliable LTE connection and it errors out with internet connection required.
Easy way to learn the board game!
I am very picky with games. This is one of the best games I have played for a very long time. I highly recommend.

title.label: Excellent implementation of a great game

content.label: Great interface and great mechanics, good turn based multiplayer structure.

There are some things in the digital that are confusing if you play the cardboard version, but overall, it’s much the same. I love this game!  The best part about it is the amount of time it takes to play. It’s so much faster.

title.label: Good game，but online is too bad

content.label: This game is amazing.I like it.But the online-game is not good.It often falls off the line and is connected for a long time. I hope it can be repaired and improved in the future
